Articles.Content:
**This has been fixed... I might have accidentally pressed F4 some time back.**

So, here's my problem. For a while I have had no target indicator on any craft. I by this, I mean I cannot see an icon on any other craft (in the world) and thus cannot double click to target them. I can still target craft by using the map view. I am currently running **KSP version 1.0.0**. I have been having this problem since 0.90. It makes playing with BDArmoury very hard, and also makes orbital rendevous rather bloody hard as I cannot see where the target craft is or its distance from me.

**Here's some illustrations:**

There is a Kerbal X stock ship sat on the launchpad. As you can see, there is no green diamond surrounding it, and I cannot double-click to target it.

> ![56d64533ec.jpg](http://puu.sh/hz9X3/56d64533ec.jpg)

The following screenshot shows a close-up of the launchpad from the IVA view of my craft. Just to prove there is actually a craft there.

> ![8a30ef73bd.jpg](http://puu.sh/hz9YQ/8a30ef73bd.jpg)

**Below is a list of my mods:**

> 
> 
> 
> - Blizzy98's toolbar
> - BahamutoD's Armory
> - CollisionFX
> - HyperEdit
> - RealChute
> - ModuleManager
> - StageRecovery
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 

I am about to test my KSP install without any mods, to see if the problem persists. Will update after.

Fixed.
F4 turns those on and off ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> F4 turns those on and off ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

... wow! Lol. Thank you very much.

Oh man....I'm so glad I found this thread. I just did two orbital rendezvous without the targeting diamond....needless to say I swore more than a few times. Thanks for this.
I second that, I spent the last two weeks with no way to track targets, was quite interesting.
